Review Description: There is no work life balance. The benefits were good, free food and insurance. They have shuttle buses and free food. Managers show favoritism and co workers gossip and backstab

Title: Computer Engineer
Review Description: All days are typical how to be humble and free giving Don't know good internet coding 10 hours job good happy joyful no sadness always good no peeping

Title: Best Workplace
Review Description:
Google is a very easy and non stressful place to work.
No micromanagement and many perks.
Awesome office Location and would recommend to everyone to wok there.

Title: Area Account Manager
Review Description: Great company to work for just ready to spread my wings and have career advancement. I enjoyed my time working here and had a great work/home life balance.

Title: Relaxed work atmosphere.
Review Description:
If you want a workplace where you can take vacation whenever you want, and nobody cares how you dress to work, this is it.

It's such a big company tho, that it's very easy to get lost in the crowd in regards to your work standing out and advancement opportunities.

Title: Fun place to work and great crew.
Review Description: I liked working for ITC Broadband. But promises were made and broken. Pay was slow to advance. It was great to push a new product that people were excited to receive.

Title: It is awesome
Review Description: Everyday I work on groundbreaking technologies with a team ready to change the future! Incredibly rewarding work environment with amazing perks everyone is familiar with.

Title: Not all it's cracked up to be.
Review Description: Poor management and leadership. Little to no advancement possibilities. Juvenile work environment with favoritism and cliques. Good place to build agency, but not a job for a professional sales person looking for a career.

Title: it was ok, but i can rate 100%
Review Description: i worked there for as temporary the problem there its only temporary, not for family needs, this job is only for singles, I was not totally 100% happy work there because thers alot of gossip, all i know was work,& wait for my pay check

Title: Lots of Perks, Very Stressfull
Review Description: No work-life balance and little opportunity for advancement due to the no hierarchy structure. Great in theory, but not in practice. Goals were not measurable and they kept changing constantly. Very difficult to keep up and make any traction or progress on any one project as the requirements constantly change.

Title: Fun, productive, and relax work place
Review Description: google gave me a perfect working environment. However, my leader seemed lacking of management skill. He is not strong at solving conflict between team member. If we take this issue as a minor, google can be known as a perfect work place.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: Fun and amazing place to work
Review Description: Unlimited potential to learn, many intelligent people to network with, and so many perks. Google treats their employees right, and encourages individuals to take on their own projects, give feedback to everyone, and make Google better for all.

Title: Great job and wonderful team to work with.
Review Description: Great job for someone that loves computers and driving. This job gave me a chance to travel and meet new people along with making a great paycheck. My team was top notch and there was nothing i would change or ask for. I loved my experience there.

Title: Productive and fun workplace
Review Description: A typical day at work is always productive yet not exhausting. People are very friendly. I've learned a lot during my short stint here. The management are always looking to push Google further.

Title: Average
Review Description: The environment can be very demotivating. There is a lot of drama that goes on and limitations to advance in your career. Training could be greatly enhanced.

Title: best place ever
Review Description: Google is one of those places that makes you feel at home. with their gyms and unlimited food resources google is a place i would go back to. sadly i move from the bay area.

Title: Review
Review Description: Great company and fun product to sell. Excellent management and support. Corporate decided to shut down the division I was in. Unfortunately. Would recommend.

Title: Nice place to be in.
Review Description: Since I would only have my internships on Friday evenings, I never really got to spend a whole ton of time in the building. What I did learn at my internship at Google was working with money, like being a sales person and how to attract customers.

Title: Nice facilities free snacks
Review Description: Nice environment. They care about keeping the employees healthy and happy. Good environment for people with diverse cultural and language backgrounds.

Title: Working for Sellbytel// Google Project
Review Description:
I have been working for Google Android Project for more than a year now, receiving inbound calls, doing outbound calls, answering customers by email when following up their potential issues/ questions and also provided help through the online chat service.
The most enjoyable part of the job was the great atmosphere at work. It s mainly due to the team itself and the "Goolgey" attidue everybody has in this project. On the top of this, all the agents receive trainings which is great when one wants to provide an efficient support to the customers. We had support as well whenever we needed from the Tier 2 agents always available on request.
Our Team Leaders were also really present and close to us which is definitely a plus when you have to deal with angry customers.

Title: Love the snacks
Review Description: I love that snacks and coffee are always available when the day gets stressful and there is no time to leave. The break room is not far from any work space.

Title: Actor
Review Description: We did doughnuts in a limo and the commercial never got played. Here are some random words garbage disposal of my favorite part of the rings and I will not be

Title: Great Company with Growing Pains
Review Description: Fitbit has established itself as a big player in the wearable technology market and it was great to be a part of its growth. I got to see the company before and after IPO. The work can be challenging or extremely boring, depending on the team. Management was pretty good, though clear paths for career advancement and mentorship were lacking. Culture is pretty isolated to teams, though it depends on how social you are. Being in downtown San Francisco is a blast, though it is very impractical for an engineering company to be so far away from other industrial suppliers.

Title: Fun and exciting work place
Review Description: People are the smartest people you will meet. Everyone is so laid back and the culture is fantastic. You can choose to work remotely from home if you choose to. Also, you have the freedom to do any 20% project you would like.

Title: Fun
Review Description: Come in and work with others on a daily basics. Fun to communicate with others. Can learn a lot from each and other. Nice snacks and Food to keep your self energized.

Title: Google fiber
Review Description: By far the worst company i ever worked for. I was employed through a sub contractor who just one night packed up and left state with all the money. They left 15 employees stranded in texas with no money no way home and without any reason.

Title: Fun place
Review Description: Great team work and get paced job. Work environment is safe filled with people who want to work. Definitely would like to grow with this job and seek all opportunity

Title: Great work environment
Review Description: Awesome place to work with great benefits and perks.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Google is a great place to work. Friendly accepting environment. The culture of Google is ever changing which makes it very diverse in everything that they do.

Title: contract position
Review Description: working here was alright. it was a contract position. you got free lunch and parking. the google full time employees were all condescending towards contractors. typical stuff.

Title: Great and fun environment
Review Description: Overall the place was great. Managers were awsome. Everyone got along well. It was very competitive but it was fun. My time there was short but I enjoyed it.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: Google
Review Description:
Make sure youre logged i on time ad prepare to assist customers
Inbound ad outbound calls
Customer service handled in professional manner
Sup escalation only if needed
Con: Limited Advancement

Title: Good
Review Description: Good company anyone would want to join. Great growth opportunities. The management is also very supportive and great learning opportunities. Work culture is also good.

Title: Hello
Review Description: This is a fun place to work and is a small company so you will have a chance to learn about a lot of different aspects of business and will need to open to change through out the day.

Title: nice place but limited on my time there
Review Description: wish it was full time. I was a contract employee so no benefits or perks. loved the job travel to and from my home was quite far but the people and atmosphere were amazing . I would recommend working at google for anyone even a chef

Title: amazing
Review Description:
I loved everything about working for them


I was only a event coordinator for a side company but the perks of the job was pretty awesome to myself I would love to go back.

Title: Excellent work environment
Review Description: Excellent work environment and amazing people to work with. The ability to to travel with in the southeastern region of the United States really taught me a lot.

Title: Google
Review Description: Great job great environment the people are very nice they offer free lunch and dinner the mangers are excellent it's just an overall great place to work

Title: Amazing job opportunity
Review Description: I got to be a part of an incredible opportunity working with the virtual head gear technology being introduced into schools. I wish I could have stayed on the project longer, and am always looking for openings at Google to rejoin the team as an employee or contractor.

Title: uncertainty with management
Review Description: New management has come in and the management has turned over every year with no clear direction. Benefits and elimination of 401K was not well recived.

Title: Easy and not a bad way to make some cash.
Review Description: Enjoyed the year I spent there. No real structure. As long as the minimum amount of hours were put in by the end of the week, you could work whenever you wanted.

Title: Great job
Review Description: Flexible hours making my own schedule any day of the week. I learned a lot about the area of New York City and New Jersey. I would certainly recommend working for Google to anyone.

Title: Summary
Review Description: It was really good working for google and I would again want o go back to google and work and culture is good free food, transportation and good team work

Title: very good
Review Description: I used to work for the company as an Internet marketing company by marketing their ads by placing ads on social networking sites and download sites and appearing through the research advisor to visit the customers

Title: Its was fun, that's it!
Review Description: This was a fun place to work and got to travel to CA and PA to see the offices and meet some really smart people. Google is a great place to work.... if you're hired directly, but if you came in by an acquisition, you were doomed from the start! Never got a real shot to shine, just immediately cross trained your replacement and that really brought down the morale of the team.

Title: Amazing company!
Review Description: Google is an incredible place to work. They have every perk you could imagine. However, it is a huge company and that's definitely not for everyone.

Title: Google at its best
Review Description: I have been working at Google full-time (Less than a year) but Work life balance not good. Change management and frequent re-org's is a draw back. Google provides awesome perks but whats the use when you dont have mental peace ?

Title: Amazing place to work
Review Description: Google is a great place to learn and start your career. There are amazing opportunities for skill and career development. People are friendly and the company cares about its employees.

Title: data base management
Review Description:
nice place
3 time food free
we can enjoy and work
no pressure work
every thing good and nice
if you are doing single mistake they will reject you

Title: Overall a good place to work
Review Description: Great benefits, great people, innovative projects. A self-starting culture that runs like a large startup. Hardest part of the job is getting overwhelmed with multiple projects in a core role while juggling passionate side projects.

Title: social
Review Description: Like the social culture. People are friendly with open minded on any subject. They are very cheerful at most of the time and a willingness to give hands up to new workers.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: The best weekend job
Review Description:
I was fortunate to work for Google whilst studying my bachelor degree.

As a Sales Demonstrator for Google, my job role involves communicating directly with customers in Carphone Warehouse and promoting Google's Pixel Phone.By showcasing the benefits, value, and usefulness of the product, make customers desirable and boost sales at a retail store by completing demonstrations in store. Positive persuasion is needed to generate interest which gives customers an incentive to buy the products.

Title: Absolutely love it !
Review Description: As a Level 1 Google Certified Educator, I can successfully implement Google Apps for Education into my teaching practice to enhance teaching and learning. This certification is for educators with a basic understanding of the key features of Google Apps as well as well as an understanding of how to meaningfully use technology in the classroom.
Con: Nothing

Title: Not a good experience
Review Description: My contract was terminated with no notice and a vague message was left for my agency saying it was due to performance. I was 2 months in and never had any inclination I was not performing well.

Title: Operations Lead
Review Description: Google was a great place to work. I made a lot of life long friends as a result while learning new skills to propel me forward in my career. I learned process improvement, lean management, and operational efficiency.

Title: proactive
Review Description: it was a good job at the beginning and at the end it was to boring for me because you would do the same thing everyday for the time you were working. but google do treat the employees good

Title: Good work culture
Review Description: has a good work life balance. the people were good and friendly. the team eas very encouraging. any new updates they would give us training. it was competitive and there is lot of scope for learning.

Title: Good place to work.
Review Description: good atmosphere, healthy work place. employee space is very good. timings are very flexible. cab facility was also good during my working period. but now its not the same. our work station was also nice.

Title: Great experience
Review Description: Worked as a Software Developer during Google's 2017 Summer of Code program. Fast-paced, highly educational opportunity for beginning software developers and the open source community. Highly recommended.

Title: Very Poor management
Review Description: Fitbit Managements are really poor. Actually, they have not any technical understandings and strategic planning for manufacturing tests. The hardest part of the job was management failed to understand the technicality. As a result, Engineering communication was always in crisis mode! The workplace culture was changed in the negative direction. I'm glad that I left!

Title: Good place to learn
Review Description: Lots and lots of digging for information and conveying that to sales reps. Can be difficult sometimes as they fight over account ownership and commision.

Title: Amazing place for advancements
Review Description: This is a great place for making amazing advancements in career. People are full of energy. There is opportunity to learn new technologies. Job is well paid.

Title: Hard job to do
Review Description: Overall, not a bad place to work. I only had experience with customer support and it wasn't the job for me. Working was monotonous and stressful which is why I decided not to pursue this career.

Title: Ever changing workplace
Review Description: Google is a very big company, which in some ways can actually feel like several different companies working together. Change is a constant in the workplace and benefits are great.

Title: great company culture
Review Description: As a software engineer intern, I learnt a lot during the internship, and get the chance of experiencing large scale project. The culture, the people and the benefit there are all great.

Title: Google
Review Description: As a associate i learned many things i google,typical day was when there was heavy load upon us of work have to extend days to complete work,google culture is awesome and friendly.

Title: Google Books Tech Ops Project Manager
Review Description:
Responsible for troubleshooting technical issues with the Google Play Books UI
● Use technical skills to establish ways to push content out to the Public in a timely matter
● Established a lead role that involves making sure Partner’s / Stakeholders request are made
Job Title: Google Books Tech Ops Project Manager

Title: Amazing experience with the world's leading internet company
Review Description: A top notch company that provides you plenty of opportunities to break into the technology/internet industry. An amazing place to work for new grads and anyone looking for a way into the world's greatest internet company.

Title: Collaborative environment
Review Description: The environment is innovative and everyone has a voice. If the area in which you are involved is not an area of extreme expertise or knowledge, each person still has a voice. This leads to creative solutions AND sometimes drives the business a direction that won't work now and will work later. Course correcting happens a lot. We are a very young (1 yr old) hardware operations organization. Exciting times - it's just in the wrong geographic location for me.

Title: Best programming shcool
Review Description: Here you can become realy an advanced java programmer. You can get a lot of useful expirience. Take a part in some interesting and modern project with newest techologies.

Title: Encourages creativity
Review Description: You are in charge of your career and are given tools and opportunities to advance yourself. Software engineering is the main focus so may not be a place for non-technical oriented people.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: fun work place
Review Description: working for google was interesting, i've learned alot,. i work on the fiber side, therefore its more construction, project managment based. over all it is a great place to work
Pro: the ability to work from home
Con: working conditions

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Google takes care of its employees, I have nothing to but good things to say about my experience there. If given the opportunity I would work for Google again.

Title: a great company
Review Description:
my experience with Google has been nothing but positive
the working environment is always changing and so is the location in which I am working. the managers are well qualified the job at hand

Title: Amazing
Review Description: Best place to work ever. People are very passionate about their job and they want to put you in the game since the first moment. Very attractive and full of joy.

Title: Great company
Review Description: Fast paced and fun but feels like a big company. There is no culture quite like this one in terms of people you can meet and mesen from and it’s truly a good challenge

Title: Good company
Review Description: Very friendly and efficient, treats its employees well. I appreciate their desire to improve people's knowledge of their products and services so that they can get the most use of out of them.

Title: pleasant environment
Review Description:
*A typical day would be hitting meetings and reaching the target.
* The hardest part is feeling competitive while able to reach the weekly targets.
* The enjoyable part of the job is the nature of the job and the work environment.
*The management was at its best while proving facilities to the employees.

Title: company with many growth potentials
Review Description:
Company has exciting vision and many growth opportunities.
Many people work long hours.
Team/group may have its own culture.
Company is experiencing rapid growth expansion in some areas while other business reaches mature stages.

Title: Great Colleagues, Poor Managment
Review Description: Little to no benefits, treated as disposable, No autonomy, no room for advancement, no recognition for good work, management will throw you under the bus to spare their own ego

Title: GSoC was a very good work experience
Review Description: It was a summer coding internship/job for students. Google pays you to work for an open source organization. I worked for KDE. Got to learn a lot. It was fun.

Title: Very Professional
Review Description: Working for Google you were on your own a lot . You were given the opportunity to reach your peak potential, the only way you could fail is if you did not want to succeed.

Title: Excellent place to work
Review Description:
Google is wonderful place to work, it is like dream come true. Best place to work, Fun, Facilities are awesome. really really good place.
Food is good.

Title: good foods
Review Description: Oh yeah, Google is nicest place to work for. Many things most people benefit because Google spent for good entertainment for their employee, such as, Gym, pool, bikes, parks, and good foods.

Title: Team based work environment but also very competitive
Review Description: I enjoy working at Google as a research coordinator because we are in a team-oriented environment but also we know what each individual needs to do to be successful. The work is different everyday and we get many new projects weekly. I love the culture at google, because it is very relaxed but people know when to work hard and when to have fun. Google has taught me a lot of different skill sets that I can take with me into my new career. The only thing that I would say that's negative is job security, and employee benefits.

Title: Best job ever
Review Description: I would still be working with Admeld if Google had not bought out the company. Staff and management were fantastic. Excellent workplace culture. Excellent co-workers.

Title: Enter all check payments into Google Document.
Review Description: Overall job was wonderful. Someday a little crazier than other, but day always brought new challenges. Wonderful supervision willing to teach me the ins and outs of servicing our clients

Title: n/a
Review Description: The company was decent. It was not too stressful, reviewed scanned images of books on a daily. Management and HR were great. Wish the pay was a bit better.

Title: Fun job, but too much smoke and mirrors
Review Description: If you can turn a blind eye to all of the dishonesty around you and focus on your job you will be very happy. Typical with large sales organizations, they look away from those that lack integrity as long as they produce numbers. It can be very cut throat but also the best training and learning experience you will get at any job. Treat it as a privilege to learn and go "all-in" and you will have a long and prosperous career. Not the culture for an honest contrarian. Long hours but excellent payout.

Title: Best place to work
Review Description: Google is known for being the best place to work at and it truly lived up to that. The clinical part of the company was always grown just like the company it'self. Work was always consistent and very enjoyable.

Title: Google Work Experience
Review Description: I worked for Google Ad Words where the environment is very competitive which is fine with me all sales environments are competitive. The job was going well until we found out we were going to a quarterly commission base pay from a monthly. We were told that we were getting a raise to compensate for the change in pay but we were not given the raise. I understand the reason behind the team not getting the raise. As a unit we failed to meet certain goals so in turn our pay was cut short. I love the job overall though, working with clients to maximize account performance is fun and I've learned a lot working for Google Ad Words.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: Work hard, play hard
Review Description: I enjoyed working at Google and formed great friendships. It was very fast-paced as I started there pre-IPO and left a few years after the IPO. I understand it is a very different company but I learned a lot during my tenure there.

Title: awesome place to work.
Review Description: I am very happy and fortunate to have had the opportunity to have had work for this great and most wonderful business. I had learned a lot. Every coworker in which I had contact with was very nice, respectful, & professional.

Title: Great Company to Work, Good work/life balance
Review Description:
I worked in the Paid Search division which at the time was owned by DoubleClick/Performics.
A lot of attention is given to employees to support them in developing a strong career path.

Title: All conditions are more than satisfied
Review Description: I will not lie if I say that Google has all conditions to work there: starting from good food and going to comfortable and entertainment rooms and sports activities. Everything is available for free. The only thing you need to think on is your work.

Title: Google is a great place to work and advance your career
Review Description: Working at Google is great and there are not a lot of issues working there. However, the one area at Google that could have been improved upon was the work life balance. As I grew older, working long hours was not what I wanted to do. As I progressed through my career at Google, I struggled to maintain a great work/life balance and found it difficult to disconnect from work due to the fact that I was working on many high pressure, high visibility projects. Other than that, Google is a great place to work and it is what you make out of it.

Title: Good Job, but not so good working for Adecco
Review Description: Working for Google is wonderful, but when you have a middle man such as Adecco it makes things very difficult in your work. Google is a great company and this opportunity is one to always remember.

Title: Good People to Work With
Review Description: I liked the culture, the projects, and the opportunity to work with stellar colleagues who taught me a lot about how to be a top rate professional. Project deadlines could be challenging. You have to be prepared to learn rapidly.

Title: Fun working place
Review Description:
Typical Day: Working different tasks depending on demand

Management: Self Managed for the most Part

Hardest Part: Deciding on what to Eat

Most Enjoyable part: Playing Ping Pong on Break with Colleges

Title: Somehow Productive
Review Description: Working in Google is fun. I have learned many things. I gained many friends. Gained confidence with my English. Improved my typing skills and multi-tasking skill.

Title: Fun workplace
Review Description: Working in the metro always poses more challenges considering the distance of the workplace and the compensation the company provides. Another point to consider are the bills and expenses you have to cover each month.

Title: Fun workplace and great co-workers
Review Description:
Best Company Ever. Great work environment and lot of scope for development. Definitely the best company to work with .

Working here is lot of fun and the targets are doable. They don't put a lot of pressure on the employees. The team leads and all the senior staff are very friendly.

Title: Productive and educational
Review Description: Typical day with Google starts at 8:30am and ends around 4-5pm depending on the job. Really great company and really great co-workers. Few things could be done differently but its currently being changed.

Title: i am under graduate student
Review Description: I have a financial problems facing by me and my family just want a little job to run my family well and full fill their wishes... I'm still a student but I have little experience so if you need any type of employee just remember me I'll be there

Title: Good work and life balance company
Review Description: Great place to work, amazing co-workers and job atmosphere, easy going people, free breakfast, lunch and dinner, only down fall about the job is that you have to go thru an temp agency, not a temp to perm position.

Title: Stressful environment, poor management
Review Description:
I worked at Google as a contractor for a year and a half.
After couple months on the job I have realized that a lot of things that have been advised prior to the start date appeared to be different in reality, i.e. micromanagement, different job tasks, manager changed, lack of leadership or lack of clear goals to follow. On top of that I could feel that I was being left out on many occasions since I was a contractor. Also I felt mistreated, I could get a random text or a phone call late in the evening from a PM asking why I did this or why I did not do this even though everything has been discussed and followed per provided instructions.
At the end of my contract I felt miserable and underestimated.
I am glad that my project ended.

Title: High Performance, fast-paced, fun workplace
Review Description:
Great co-workers
Supportive Management
Flexible work environment
Feels like home because of the good care Google takes of its employees
Once a Googler, always a Googler!

Title: productive and fun
Review Description: productive and fun work place. very social work place with lots of friendly vibes. meeting lots of people. learning and educating others. being apart of google history.

Title: Fast Paced and Fun Work Environment
Review Description:
Working at major tech companies through contract positions is a very effective and efficient way to get a head start on one's professional career.

The management and team on-site is very communicative and looks to help you grow as both an individual and working professional.

Networking is a key aspect of positions such as this and a lot of what you get from the role is what you make of it. My advice is to be outgoing, communicative, and always looking for ways to prove yourself.

I would definitely work here again if the opportunity arose.

Title: It was a job
Review Description:
I was on the Google Play contract with Xerox for two years. The pay was less than stellar, the benefits were below par, and the work environment was a few card tables in a poorly ventilated room for the first few months I worked there.

Xerox lost the contract eventually, so there is no real reason to utilize this review to judge any other Google contracts against my own experiences.

Title: a big company
Review Description:
- One meets interesting people
- Sales organization is gradually maturing at Google
- Smart people with lots of differing interests
- Gradually more conscious of external environment

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: a fun and nice place to work
Review Description: I learned a lot at Google and also enjoyed working there. It was a very competitive but enjoyable workplace. Google took care of its employees very nicely with break out areas within 10 -15 paces of our desks, massage chairs, cab services, etc.

Title: Productive fun place to work
Review Description: Get to see the world and eat for free. Weekly pay was decent especially with overtime. Going from one state to another was nice. Having $65 dollars per day for per diem was more than enough to eat daily. Paid five star hotels and new rental car vehicles. Hotel and rental car reward points was great!!!☺
Pro: Free food and travel. Paid every week. No supervision good company to work for..
Con: Contract expired to soon at very short notice.

Title: Fun but stressful
Review Description: Its a easy job. You just go from place to place and make sure that Google's products are advertised right and that the employees know everything about the products they sale.

Title: Travelling around the country
Review Description:
Amazing offices around the world, excellent restaurants and great equipment.

A lot of travelling involved but always with support to make it possible.

Title: Good collaboration
Review Description:
I'd like to find out more on growing the CPC rate.
I love working with Google for the freedom kind of opportunity a publisher gets when working with you.
Thanks

Title: Really good
Review Description: Really good company to work for. Lots of perks, good salary.

Title: Good
Review Description:
Professional & friendly environment, free food/gym/perks/snacks etc.
As a contractor - not a lot of room for growth. Its good for a family person (35y.o. and above). For young person - better to work in fast-paced competitive start-up

Title: Challenging Team and Work
Review Description:
-New aspects and different ways to approach things
-trying to think differently and being a subject matter expect
-come-up with new ideas on a day to day basis

Title: Candid work place, great environment
Review Description: Looker was a great place to work at, the culture was friendly and everyone is candid. I especially had a good time getting to know the higher management.

Title: fun job cool perks
Review Description: work in google merchandising through a third party had lot of fun meeting people who loved their goggle products, area mangers and google direct office was a great help when needed any help on projects

Title: Great benefits. Nurturing environment for motivated individuals.
Review Description: Overall, Google is an amazing place to work. Your day-to-day can be vastly different depending on what team you're on and what your role is. The one thing that's consistent for all teams is that innovators and those with a motivated work ethic will excel, no matter where you are on the corporate ladder.

Title: productive and fun place
Review Description:
I learnt a lot on myself when I was on the field.
everyday is different.
Thanks to the training you learn a lot about different useful applications.
you interact with different people from different countries.
you travel a lot

Title: Fun place with a lot of technology to learn
Review Description: Workplace is good and a lot of things to learn from here in terms of technology. A lot of interesting work and intent to connect all technology partners is the key.
Job Title: DGM at Foray Soft and Consultant at Google

Title: Productive Fun Place to Work
Review Description:
A typical day of work and checking the work load and request sent in the morning.
Complete the task that require immediate attention. Occasionally an urgent request will appear.
There are daily up keep task that are done in the morning. While the rest of the day is spent working on various projects.
Time management is largely necessary to stay on top of things.

The work environment is very friendly and relaxing.

Hardest part of the job and influx of work can appear at a moments notices.
I have learn new skills in SFDC and analytic insights.

Title: Cool
Review Description:
Cool job and team.
Great food and perks
Cool gym and swimming pool
Cool travel and buildings
Not much space for creativity and advancement, wishing for more
Job Title: Marketing Events Project Manager, Google Partners

Title: Excellent Place
Review Description:
I worked as an FTE for Google ,Best best place to work , excellent environment, best peers.
Excellent scope for the fresher to learn and grow.
Must work place in an IT Carrer

Title: Great
Review Description:
Great place, fun to work

Very busy, meeting deadlines

Learn alot

Progress through job role

Interesting place, large teams,

Good people, good work ethics

Title: A Nice Place To Work
Review Description: It's a nice place to work. The people are pleasant and positive. The work is not overbearing, but just enough to keep a person motivated on the daily basis.

Title: Active Team member
Review Description: we were four members of IT team in our company and use to handle 140 Coffee Stores. Every day was challenging for us because of new issues and Work pressure. I being in IT Team has fixed has found a way to print Receipt for online ordering.

Title: working at a job
Review Description: typical day at work is always busy,witch is good by me. because by me staying busy? IT SEEMS TO make the time go by much faster.AND THE more i work? The more i learn, because each day is a learning exprience . which makes the job more exciting. The hardest part is when some people slack in their work assigment. But thats when i have to work extra hard. just to make sure that the job is done correct. The fun part of the job is getting may pay check .

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: I never worked at google
Review Description: I never worked at google never ever evr evr ever worked at google i dont kknpw why you think i worked at google but i never worked at google ever ever

Title: Name is enough
Review Description: Google don't need any introduction. And the atmosphere where I work was awesome. No other company till date I like much I like Google. I was working for Google products like Google Pixel phones, Chromebook, play cards, Chromecast

Title: what i learned
Review Description: It had been a great experience with the company. It was my first job and i have learnt a lot from it. It taught me how to be professional and I learnt about work culture

Title: Google via Randstad
Review Description: This was a very fun place to work, they did lots of activities to keep people fresh and engaged. I really enjoyed it, unfortunately my position was a contract with an end date. So unless you could figure out something else to do that was needed to further the project then you were done.

Title: Access to Google perks is nice, job is terrible
Review Description:
Made to believe that music experience would be relevant, but whenever it came up, was shut down in favor of "following the guidelines." Was made to believe that there would be health benefits: NOPE. The prices are identical to the marketplace.
The amount of research is minimal. Most of the research has to go through designated sources, so the majority of this job is data entry. The only reason I'm keeping this job right now is as supplemental income. If you're looking for a real job, look elsewhere.

Title: fun
Review Description: Google was amazing to work for. Fun times. Great people. Facilities were amazing. Long hours but the perks made up for it. Loved every minute of the experience.

Title: Excellent place to work
Review Description:
You will work hard
You will work together
You will have fun
You will learn new things
You will get stressed out

In my experience everyone is treated as a responsible adult. The culture is fantastic and collaborative.

The only gripe I have is that often there are high level direction changes that require you to refocus on a new area without notice and the can be a problem when in an external facing role as you will have to redirect partners who are not privy to that direction change.

Title: Great job but no room for advancement
Review Description:
Great job, meet tons of people.
Travel is great. Visible job. You will encounter tons of people wanting to talk about your job daily.
Software experience needed

Title: N/a
Review Description: Its a greta place to work. The work culture is nice, relaxing, and fun. You will enjoy your projects if you stay up to speed on relevant skills needed.

Title: Productive workplace and Collaborative culture
Review Description: Very cost driven which is typical at any company. Great place to learn how to work with international cross-functional teams. Always leverage data to align stakeholders.

Title: A place for opinionated people
Review Description:
Fun place to work. Lots of perks. Smart people.

But, lack of direction, focus and "discipline".

The hiring process brings in (or used to hire) some smart, but opinionated primadonnas that can overwhelm meetings and discussions.

Title: Best Company
Review Description: Cognizant-Google is the best company that I have worked for. The office ambiance was superb. Very generous when it comes to awards and giveaways. Free lunch was awesome!

Title: Google creates an environment for creativity to thrive.
Review Description:
Google creates an environment for creativity to thrive.
The difference being the people they hire. Each team member is an expert at their field and it's through these people that relationships are built.

Title: Excellent working environment and work culture
Review Description: Very relaxed yet competitive work culture. Learned to work in diverse environment, improved management and technical skills. Never thought working would be fun before working in Google!

Title: Works are good and going on well
Review Description:
Sometimes work will be hard but should be doing as my duty.
How to handle customers and solving problems i learned in these yrs
Good friendly atmosphere

Title: Here interesting and instructive
Review Description:
This company is very standers
Rule regulation better than other company
I learnt lot of things from this company, they did train us for fourteen
days
No hardest part for the company but need to be careful
It's really enjoyable place to work.

Title: Best
Review Description:
best everrrr
Days were Hectic but i felt occipied
it was as any other GA work but was worth it and would love to work in a space like pace where i can be the person i am and can do what im best at

Title: amazing place to work
Review Description: My longest time was spent at this company. I learned people skills along with work. awesome place to work for any starter.I got promoted to higher levels at very early stages.they trust the employees.

Title: Beautiful grounds
Review Description: It's nice to go to work where you see squirrels and birds in the tree and get free food. The culture is young, but innovative with many smart people. It was a comfortably challenging job.

Title: exploring New technologies
Review Description: I love to learn new technologies with self learning capabilities.Worplace will be moderate enough & work management skills will be improved.Playing team member is fine

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: Great experience
Review Description: Worked there on a contract basis, enjoyed the way they handled the paperwork, the paycheck came on time, support was just a call or email away. I could work from home and take care of my family.

Title: great if you like the product
Review Description: not my cup of tea, im oly writting the review because i cant continue without doing so. a job is a job and a career is a career do what makes you happy

Title: Adecco/Google
Review Description: Fun and enjoyable atmosphere. No complaints at all on my part. I was a contract position so my expectations were not high but I was surprised by the warm welcome.

Title: Good place to start
Review Description: not bad, could be better. Learned a lot and would reccomend starting here to get a foot in the door and learn valuable skills. But would want the company to be more open about why they provide compensation and actual work.

Title: Amazing work environment
Review Description: This job was very rewarding because i was given the opportunity to help, low income, minority students brushen up their skills before they went on to the next grade.

Title: Advertiser
Review Description:
I worked from home on my computer, uploading videos to be monetized on YouTube and generate a revenue per click on every ad.
The RPM needs to stay on a higher rate in order to increase the revenue.
Sharing videos on social media increases the audience which allows people to click on the ads shown on videos.

Title: ITF in Granville County Schools
Review Description: This job has very poor working conditions, unrealistic expectations, very poor salary and benefits, lack of advancement, poor managers and I could not recommend it to anyone.

Title: Great
Review Description: Great place to work. Free food. Fascinating work. Pay is really great, people nice. Would recommend working there any time. I would go back again if I wasn't on a contract that expired.

Title: great team and good managers
Review Description: I was a contractor so my experience was different than employees. but, it was a great gig for me. Team was supportive, manager was great, and the perks awesome! the food alone was enough to make me love working there. I learned a lot, contributed to the team in big ways, and worked with amazing people!

Title: A very political place to work.
Review Description: It may sound good working for Google but it is not. Working for Google is more of who you know than what you know. A very political place of employment.

Title: Very productive and fun work environment.
Review Description: From the first day of training, the experience of being there is very euphoric. The training was very fun and interactive with the other trainees and trainer. The first day of work was just how the trainer told us it would be; very fast pace, interactive with other co workers from Google, and laid back as well. Every day was the same but different, either pick customer order, pay for it with with Google credit card, or pack the orders' after they've been paid for. I learned how to keep that process moving fast and steady to where the customers get their orders fast and in one piece. It helped a lot, that that the leads, supervisors, and management from the main office were very kind and always willing to help. The hardest part for me, was the commute to work. I lived in Oakland and the job was in Hayward, which was three cities away. All the together the job was fun nd the people were some of the best of the co workers I've ever had.

Title: Cutthroat
Review Description: This was a boiler room of sales reps that were petty and used scripted pitcheds to sell services to the public that were shady at best. I have to type in something to fill the balnk space so this is all i want to say.

Title: Great Experience
Review Description: Great Job that i gained great experience but unforonately it was a contract job so my time there ended. Overall The company treated me equal and i had a great working experience .

Title: A wonderful work enviroment with fun employees
Review Description: Coming to work for a company that really wants you to have fun and excel while working was a dream for me. They really taught me about work ethics and enjoying your job while earning a decent pay check.

Title: The Environment which I got was Ideal. The workstation was simply amazing and the leaders who guided me towards the process understood me well.
Review Description: Reviewing from day 1, I learned a lot in this 4 month tenure. Being A fresher, This job will always be a cherish able experience since I got to know deep down What my capabilities are. The hardest part of the job being the targets set by Google which were to be achieved on regular basis. The most enjoyable part were the sessions conducted by google to get a better insight of what "Google Ad word and YouTube channel" marketing is.

Title: Interesting place to work
Review Description: Travel all over Europe, the work environment is formidable. Exciting company. Relaxed work environment. You get many perks working here. Free meals, gym, snacks, coffee, and etc.

Title: Amazing opportunity
Review Description: It was always fun to work there. Smiling faces around, helpful co-workers make your life better. I loved the culture, and learned many new things there.

Title: Very fast paced
Review Description: You need to be on your toes and sharp to work there. There's a lot of smart and competitive people. lots of great lifestyle perks, but expect the hours to be typically longer than most companies.

Title: Productive and Friendly Enviroment
Review Description:
typical day would be coming in and having a chat with a few colleagues. Then going to our desk and sign to see what our assignments.
I learned to work faster but yet accurate.
The workplace is magnificent and really comfortable and has many people from different backgrounds.
Hardest part is to remember all Policies for the first few months but it gets better gradually.
Most enjoyable is playing and walking around the business area as it has beautiful lakes and people play sports on the grass patches.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: Great work enviorenmet. People were really helpful and friendly. The CEO was very supporting. Management was pretty good. It was an awesome place to work.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: Not a great place to work
Review Description: The Evolution is going back words, supporting a premium google product, Accenture is getting back to the terms of chat from email and soon I can see days where they are going to make it as a call center

Title: productive and fun work place
Review Description:
Pushed to work well, but encouragingly.
Friendly work place, good management, nice hours.
Neat social events, would recommend as a place of work.
Good progression

Title: Exemplory large tech company
Review Description:
Google isn't perfect but it almost certainly comes the closest of any company with dozens of thousands of employees.

A typical day as an Eng. Mgr. is filled with meetings, most of which are actually productive and interesting. The balance is usually spent reading and responding to email or looking through artifacts created by the team you manage.

I've learned how to organize and empower people to be productive and happy engineers. Upper management can often be ignorant of how things are in the trenches but there are excellent tools for bubbling up widespread discontent so it does generally get addressed.

The hardest part of the job tends to be staying abreast of all the change happening across such a gigantic organization, since you never know when something will impact you.

The most enjoyable part of the job is talking to the great coworkers, especially over daily free lunch.

Title: Great
Review Description: I am a fresher want to experience the world a more and more thr is so much to be found i look foward to work with joy and wisdom i hope my mistakes will be neglected.

Title: Collecting GPS data to support Google Maps
Review Description: Exciting company. Relaxed work environment, with very little stress. Plenty of travel. Google really does take care of you and provides you with everything needed to do a good job.

Title: poor work environment
Review Description:
good company a little unorganized
compensation fair
work environment poor
short breaks no relievers
no job security at all
poor benefits
no growth with no comp

Title: Google Kirkland
Review Description:
I liked to start work early. This was not a problem with my managers. I was a tester for Android Hangouts. We had sufficient equipment to do our jobs and very good supervision. Google's tools are easy to learn and use, for the most part and issues seem to get fixed in a reasonable amount of time.

I enjoyed working with our leads and Manager. They worked extremely hard getting us up to speed on changing features. Google's facilities are first rate! I would be very happy to go back on another Vendor job if the opportunity arises.

Title: Vendor working at Google is not fun
Review Description: This review does not accurately represent Google since I am a vendor. I work under Accenture/VACO. As a vendor, you are not a "real" Googler and you are treated like an afterthought and the real Googlers are embarrassed by you.

Title: Na
Review Description:
It is a place that I call heaven on earth and the working experience is literally awesome which I cannot explain in my words, Please if anyone gets an option to work with such company please don't let go off.
By the way, my experience is this if you people like it take is positive if not never mind.

Title: Perfect Working Place to Interact with Decent People
Review Description: Google in New York was a decent working place with full of creative and skillful people. My manager always supported me during the difficult projects. It was great to had a lot of experience in marketing and SEO fields.

Title: Dead end company
Review Description:
Awful management in many departments, ranging from simple incompetence to toxic management.

They lost the culture that made them special soon after going public. Now they are a lifeless company struggling to stay relevant and dreaming of being like their tech giant competitors.

When I started the company was about free and expensive goodies, lavish parties, and wildly varying compensation. By the time I left almost all of the major perks had gone. Not that perks are a reason to work somewhere, but in the course of a year they went from over-spending on everything, to getting increasingly stingy.


Only work here if you are just starting out. There are much better options in larger, established companies or younger startups.

Title: Awesome work envrionment
Review Description: Work environment is awesome. You get many perks working here. Free meals, gym, snacks, coffee, and etc. Although depending on what program you are in, it can be hard to move up.

Title: Operations Technician
Review Description: I was a Contractor at X for about a year. You almost get all the benefits as a full time employee, but not the normal status of a FTE. You will be looked down upon due to this reason.

Title: Great culture
Review Description: I enjoy working at Google, it's a very team oriented company where you feel that you are all working for the same goal. Everyone I have worked with has been exceptional!

Title: It was Accenture and not Google
Review Description: It was fun working at the client site Google, never had any issues. It was never a boring day at work, always exciting, something new to learn everyday, lot of challenges

Title: Google
Review Description: Great place to work at, lots of benefits, free food, gym, massage etc. Employee feel so relaxing to work at Google which is way too good for employee.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description:
Good atmosphere where work can be completely balanced.
Excellent place to work with good infrastructure.
Great place to learn many things.
Work life can be easily balanced while working with Google.

Title: productive and fun place to learn
Review Description: it was a very productive experience for me. i got to interact with a lot of customers and employees on a very professional level. i learned a lot while using electronic devices as well to help assist us in our daily tasks.

Title: really a fantasy Job
Review Description: working for them was really nice and easy. very peaceful and friendly. Wish there were many more places like this one. As long as you do what your suppose to do as any other place your good! especially at Google

Title: Incredibly smart, talented and amazing people
Review Description: Being a contractor at Google has it's downside for sure. Management views you as disposable, you're not afforded the obvious benefits of full time employees and you can't remain at the company for longer than 2 years. Google is a fast moving machine and I was afforded the opportunity to work on a huge variety of projects with a LOT of autonomy.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: Agency Business Development
Review Description:
Typical day of work - admin, emails, client service, team meeting, cross functional team work, best practice sharing, travel to client meetings, quarterly planning
Excellent work culture
Good management team
Excellent perks and benefits
Good cross functional collaboration
Con: Hard to get promoted

Title: Great company, lackluster execution.
Review Description: The culture in the company is phenomenal. However, because all of the work done is remote, it can be very difficult to identify with the aforementioned culture and remember your "why". Compensation is more than fair and the job is flexible.

Title: A great workplace where you can learn skills, balance your life and meet brilliant people
Review Description:
Working at Google is a dream of many people. Indeed, it provides you with the best working environment, learning system and support from everywhere.

When you work in Google, you will find out how less you know because the colleagues either have high degrees or strong working background. But they are all willing to help. Even during the lunch time, people love to discuss their work, not regard work as a task or stress.

In addition, you can enjoy the free beverage, snacks, meal, fruits, gym, massage, entertainment facilities, nursing room, even tents and sofa for a nap. Besides, Google always has activities like "T-shirt design competition","bike to work day" to enrich your working life; free training program like CPR certificate and so on.

Google has everything you may or may not (lol) need, the company only wants "googlers" to focus on their work.

Title: Stressful
Review Description:
Great perks and benefits. Terrible people management.

I never felt comfortable at Google. Everything you do is logged and closely monitored leaving the management team with the ability to use any negative performance metric against you for your performance review. Google certainly plays favorites.

Title: Great company
Review Description: A great company to be at and work for. Extremely caring and driven environment where everybody is working hard to have a positive impact on the world

Title: Productive Workplace, Often Stressful
Review Description: Management is incredibly flexible with work hours and starting/leaving time. Working from home happens often. Parking and commute can be a pain due to congested roads. Workplace is open environment, so it can get loud. Lots of interesting, challenging problems you're likely to never see anywhere else. Security has the benefit of having the support of upper management tiers, making it less cumbersome to get your work done. Friendly working environment, albeit the job itself can be very, very stressful if you're bad about work/life balance.

Title: it's probably a great place to work if you are not a contractor.
Review Description: Probably great place to work if you are not a contractor! As a contractor, your access is very restricted. Management style is ok, not mircor management. Communication is relaxed.

Title: Really takes care of their people
Review Description: Had a really good time at Google. One of the biggest perk for working here is there are always fun problems to solve. The amenities are great and the food awesome.

Title: As a full time employee it would have been great, as a contractor - it wasn't good.
Review Description: Full time employees and contractors are two different kinds of people and are treated as such here. It made working here really stressful, difficult, and caused a lot of tension amongst our team.

Title: Workplace nd job
Review Description: Good to work with such a big company. Good support from the leads to complete the given task. Friendly Environment. Reaching the targets. Overall it is a good experience.

Title: Productive and fun at workplace
Review Description:
I liked working here because it was so much fun never felt like work
it never felt like we were working because it was so much fun. Weekends were off so best

Title: I like Google
Review Description: Before we buy a new gadget or try a new restaurant, most of us look at the reviews at Amazon, or Yelp, or whichever online retailer or site we're browsing, just to make sure we're not wasting our hard earned money on something useless.Some are useless and angry, and others are so glowing that can't be real. The best ones walk between, and regardless of the experience the reviewer had, they offer up the kind of information that's invaluable when making a decision. Here's how you can write those kinds of reviews.

Title: Amazing work place
Review Description: Been with Google for over a year and really enjoyed working with amazing people that makes every day an enjoyable experience. Opportunity to really own your work and collaborate with other teams across the world.

Title: Job overview
Review Description: Google was an awesome job, I worked independent based on my assignment for the week. Management was available if needed. Traveled to various cities.

Title: Great place to work and co-workers were very friendly and helpful
Review Description: My six-month stint at this location was workplace Heaven!...Free lunch (gourmet or ala-carte), employee lounges with games, scooter for travel in the massive office space. The number of interviews just to consult were five or six in number (for employees - something like nine to eleven interviews).

Title: Google Maps
Review Description: Poorly ran both from Google and Adecco. Treated horribly by higher level Google management. The simple but unfortunate reality is you're a number. That's it. Period.

Title: Contract life is hard
Review Description: There are really great perks and you feel like you are part of a large company but I found that the full-time employees treat you differently. Like you are less. It makes it hard to feel like you are valued.

Title: It's a big company
Review Description: Google is all about the bottom line and you feel it in the culture. It is a high-pressure company with a high expectation of results. They provide a lot but they expect a lot

Title: Stressfull
Review Description: It was a temp job, I was always worried to lose my job the same day. I had to work I wouldn't tecommendand stayed focus for 10 hours straight if I wanted to keep my job.

Title: Not great for TVCs
Review Description:
Although working at Google might be great, as a TVC you aren't a true employee and you truly feel it.

Although I was promised a chance at conversion, it became painfully clear that there is less than 1% of a chance to convert in TVC roles.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: very competive work place day consist of work machines
Review Description: day should start with a good attitude ready to work and keep and a fast pace to hit a qoata and control scanning for a focused clean picture for online customers

Title: good times
Review Description: It was an experience and i learned a lot about leadership and creating a positive work environment. I got to manage 30-40 for the southeast region and travel all over and work for one of the biggest companies in the world. I loved it. And will miss it
Con: Temporary Contractor

Title: Great culture
Review Description: Supportive culture and nice people. Makes it fun to work there. Impactful projects. Good food. Depending on how high up your position is affects your work life balance.

Title: Productive and Steady Work environment
Review Description:
Coordinate events that took place in building.
Managed fluid work environment for software engineers.
Free Food!
Hardest part about the job was staying busy because sometimes there really was nothing to do. I have never been comfortable with sitting around doing nothing.
Management was great.

Title: Productive and Fun Work Place
Review Description: Working Within Google taught me most of my IT skills and all my general knowledge when it comes to businesses and advertisement. I also learnt about accounts and credit control etc.

Title: Stressful with lack of structure
Review Description: Bad structure and poor management. Nothing ever makes any sense. They have lied about its compensation in the beginning and snese then the pay structure still doenst add up.

Title: Very beneficial with potential for training and future learning
Review Description:
Excellent company to work with and very strong communication from management down - the goals are set and very clearly communicated which puts everyone on the same wave length.

There is always the potential to undertake training to grow yourself and offer more to the business.

Title: Great to work
Review Description: Really good place to work and expand, endless opportunity while you work. Always great to know that you can expand and have lots of different things to do.

Title: good work place
Review Description: good to work and great work life balance and great to be with google and its amazing job to work at. management is good and i would recommend every one to work at this place.

Title: Not a great place for parents with kids
Review Description: Even though they mentioned in the interview that they were a family oriented company, it was not true. The perks are really only for the single Engineers. The carpool buses hour do not accommodate parents who have to pick kids up from school.

Title: fun place and the best people
Review Description: Google appeals to all of the different types of learners and teammates. People are generally very accepting of different ideas and the innovative nature of the tech world drives us forward.

Title: If your political views aren't in agreement you'll be treated badly
Review Description: If your political views aren't in agreement with management, you'll be treated badly. They will not let up until you leave. It's all about politics.

Title: Great place to work with a nice array of growth opportunities
Review Description: Google is a fast paced company with many new projects, programs, and challenges popping up everyday. It can be difficult to keep up with the all of the changes and work/life balance is always an issue. Management is flexible and accommodating which makes dealing with the sheer volume of issues a bit easier.

Title: Fun and productive job
Review Description: Learnt a lot, worked a lot harder than I imagined and it was fulfilling. The co-workers are who make your life so much easier. The technical expertise is tremendous.

Title: Exciting and one-of-a-kind work environment
Review Description: As a store operator, I drove my own car to a large chain store that Google was partnered with and stayed in a back stock room with the rest of the team. We would get specialized smartphones that received incoming shopping orders that we would then purchase from the store with a Google credit card, neatly package, and place them in a convenient location at the store and wait for the courier drivers to pick up the packages. Some days were busy all day, some days only had one or two orders. The people who worked alongside me were great people. Very friendly and fun to work with, The manager took her job a little too seriously, and didn't interact with the rest of us unless it was to give orders or tell us we did something wrong. The hardest part of the job was finding some of the items, as stores like Target or Toys-R-Us have huge amounts of products. The most enjoyable part of the job was having fun with your co-workers and making work into something of a game or competition that would give us motivation, increase our productivity, and keep our spirits up.

Title: Productive and Organized
Review Description: Worked on quality control of scanned documents using a computer programs through google. Not much supervision, quick turnover requested, didn't listen to employees, supervisor listened to music all day and didn't assist colleagues

Title: Fast pace and challenging. Always keeping up with the changes
Review Description: Loved my position. However, the project wasn't forever. Great place to work with great people. Super fast paced work day. So many cool projects to be apart of.

Title: Productive and Inviting place to work.
Review Description:
There really is, Not a Typical Day. It's always changing, and it keeps you on your toes. Very exciting and collaborative.

I learned that the Google culture is very inviting and collaborative, which was a huge change from my previous places of employment. My Peers actually invited my ideas and respected my knowledge.

My Managers were top notch. I could not ask for better.

The Culture at at Google is Great. Lots of diversity, a very lean dress code, and you can bring your dog to work with you if you wish. Bow Wow.

The hardest part of my job was leaving, after being such an integral person of the development of the Operations Dept. of the Carolina's.

The most enjoyable part of my job, was seeing success. The contracts taking hold and being executed. The Network being built, accepted and customers signing up. To be point blank, Watching Growth that I had been personally responsible for. To be a part of a start up, in the already saturated Telco and ISP industry, making waves with the incumbents and making history at the same time. This is definitely a part of telecom history that will never be forgotten, and I am very proud to have been a part of that.
Job Title: Network Deployment and Operations Field Manager

Title: Very enjoyable and fulfilling work
Review Description: I loved how fun and easy it was. Everything was made very simple and the work load was beyond a breeze. I loved working with the children and the team of coworkers.

Title: Fun Place To Work and Learn
Review Description: Fun Place To Work and Learn in small teams. Great food and great preks. Flexible work hours and holidays Good benefits including massages at work. Good job stability.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: As a contractor, you are not expected of much performance at the same time can't excel much for career advancement. Contract agents will get you in with a lower pay in the brand name of Google. Just need to be tactful on that.
Con: Contractors' separation from Googlers. Could be bullied at times

Title: they have all the recreational in the company
Review Description: working in Goggle is very secretive company not to expose they product once the project finished they let you go. I enjoy working in even in short time.
Con: no benefits i was temporary

Title: One of the best places to work
Review Description:
Google is the best place to work if you love your freedom and are crazy. The culture, and the experience is incredible. I made great friends, met very intelligent people and also discovered myself during my three years with Google.

Everyday was different and there was so much more to your work than just your job. All in all, it was a tremendous journey.

Title: Fun place to work
Review Description: The people are smart and they care about each other. But, sometimes I wished the company did not put so much emphasis just in coders vs other employees.

Title: Good place to work for,
Review Description: Good place to work for, People are very helpful. I loved working for the company. Very competitive, embrace all different culture of different world. food is good and free.

Title: Fun. Outside work.
Review Description: Driving a Google Map Street car was a great experience. Would be great if a full time position but the positions are seasonal. Great tech support and managerial support for any issues that arose.

Title: a good place to work with
Review Description:
ppl are young and aggresive and helpful, most of the Tech travels not only locally but internatinally (but base on their job task).

There's always food in the break room. but lunch was cut out but there's still happy hour.
Job Title: IT Security Acct Mgmt and IT Support Specialist

Title: Most craziest and fun place to work
Review Description:
My first job and turned out to be a dream place to work.
Had a lot of fun working at Google. Never felt stressed working at this organisation.
Good place to work

Title: workplace culture
Review Description: open culture, big company with some bureaucracy, business roles usually revolve around ads, perks are great (food, massages, work space), usually only hire for functions you have experience in, internal mobility is possible around 1-2 years.

Title: worthy work and balanced lifestyle
Review Description: Work at the company gives a chance to prove ourselves.A new challenges in the work improves our skills with great confidence and motivation.Management helps to encourage in all aspects.Great Team leads,

Title: Work place is very motivating
Review Description:
Google provides a variable culture and this makes work an amazing experience.
I'm here on a third party pay roll, looking for better role and opportunities to portray myself.

Title: Choose management that are creative, yet responsible. So many of my managers were fun and creative, yet immature. Either that, or they were too strict
Review Description: Choose management that are creative, yet responsible. So many of my managers were fun and creative, yet immature. Either that, or they were too strict/ bossy with little creativity, and it makes a huge difference for the sales associates.

Title: Great place to start
Review Description: Great place to start out. They train you for everything you need to know. Good free food everyday. Nice break rooms with lots to do, and a one year contact that can turn into a second year one as long as your a good employee.

Title: Retaliate against smart employees that have a voice
Review Description: Company is full of know it alls that know nothing. Like working in a high school cliche situation. If you are friends then you advance. If you have a brain you are shamed.

Title: great brains, but lacking in expertise
Review Description:
As a consultant it is a very Strange culture. Often overwhelming feeling of being "on the outside, looking in" and treatment of contractors is very different than other companies. They try very hard to keep them separate from the employee culture (putting them in their own areas or not integrating them with employees etc) Google has a pool of great brains, graduated from best universities. However their lacking in expertise in the field they are employed leaves them miles behind other tech companies in finding a solution or curing the 'bleeding' - so back office operations are very primitive, and use of BPO's high. Still very manual considering they are a tech giant.
Company needs more diversity in seasoned and experienced employees. People are reclusive here, like there is no other world outside of the company, and entitlement is prevalent.

Benefits culture is good, with free food and activities, however teams still lack cohesion - the kind that other companies have mastered. It seems all the perks won't build a great team, unless you have a good manager that has people skills. Which is something that is lacking here.

Overall, they have good pay, and good work life balance, since no one really is burning the midnight oil here.

Title: • Familiarity with lab equipment.
Review Description:
• Follow established reliability test procedures and perform various environmental and mechanical reliability testing, photography of failures for documentation, and report generation.
• Set up and run test equipment (Environmental Chambers, UV Chamber, Thermal Cycling Chamber)
• Perform Chemical test, Drop test with high speed camera tumble test II Heina’s, RCA Abrasion test, Auto force test, Force gauge test (Nidec Shimpo FGV-200xy), Cross hatch test, Engagement cycle test.
• Record, analyze, and report test results using spreadsheets and charts.
• Update/upload the firmware
• Build fixtures to set up the units for final testing
• Maintain and operate the 3D printer
• Perform soldering of small component (0402 or smaller) under microscope.
